modules.description: Creates a pie chart from a list of labeled sectors, with optional donut hole styling. Accepts a list of (label, value) pairs and supports adding sectors incrementally. Renders directly into a specified HTML element using a unique display type.

Creates a visual gauge element that displays a numeric value within a specified range, using color thresholds to indicate status. Operates on float values, strings for labels and units, and color codes. Renders directly into a DOM element with a specified ID, suitable for real-time monitoring dashboards.

Creates a line segment for a line chart using a list of (x, y) coordinate pairs and a label. Supports different rendering styles defined by the kind type, with a default of straight lines. Converts kind values to strings for display purposes.

Creates and manipulates line charts with support for time series or XY data, using segment-based data structures. Adds individual or grouped segments to build charts, and updates or extends rendered charts dynamically. Renders charts to a display target and allows for real-time data flow adjustments.

Provides functions to create and configure line, bar, and pie charts, including methods to set data series, axes labels, and chart dimensions. Works with OCaml lists and tuples to represent chart data and configuration parameters. Used to render interactive visualizations in web applications compiled with js_of_ocaml.

Combines charting and visualization tools for dynamic data representation, including pie charts, gauges, and line charts with interactive updates. Handles labeled data, numeric ranges, and coordinate-based segments, supporting incremental construction and real-time rendering. Allows precise control over visual elements like colors, labels, and display styles. Enables creation of complex dashboards with features such as adjusting minimum x-values, removing points, and rendering to specific DOM elements.
